title: Calories in 1/2 Cup 2% Milk
meta_description: Learn calories in 1/2 cup 2% milk: about 61 kcal with 4g protein, full nutrition facts, equivalents, and tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Pasteurized, homogenized reduced-fat (2%) cow's milk; 1 cup = 244 g (USDA standard); no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, fat content, fortification, and processing; check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: 1/2 cup of 2% milk provides ~61 kcal and ~4 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 1/2 cup 2% milk?
faqs.a: Approximately 61 kcal for 1/2 cup (122 g) of 2% milk.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 1/2 cup 2% milk?
faqs.a: About 4 g of protein per 1/2 cup serving.

faqs.q: Does 2% milk have carbs or sugars?
faqs.a: Yes, ~5.9 g carbs and 6.2 g natural sugars (lactose) in 1/2 cup.

faqs.q: How does 2% milk compare to whole milk calories?
faqs.a: 2% has fewer calories (~61 vs. 74 kcal per 1/2 cup) due to lower fat.

faqs.q: Is sodium high in 1/2 cup 2% milk?
faqs.a: No, only ~57 mg sodium per 1/2 cup, which is low.
